title: WATCH: Duo face spitting action
text:
Diego Godin and Deyverson could face action after spitting incidents Last Updated: 28/01/17 6:57pm Diego Godin and Deyverson may face hefty action from the Spanish FA after spitting at each other during Atletico Madrid’s 0-0 draw with Alaves on Saturday. Diego Godin and Deyverson may face action from the Spanish FA after spitting at each other during Atletico Madrid’s 0-0 draw with Alaves on Saturday. 
After being caught by Godin's elbow late on, Deyverson was seen spitting in the Uruguayan defender's direction as the players jostled at a free-kick, before Godin returned the gesture moments later. 
Though Atletico captain Godin was booked for the initial elbow incident, neither spitting incident was noticed by the referee. 
Tensions had been rising between the two players since half-time when Deyverson, who was incensed by the treatment Godin had given him, took his shirt off and offered it to the defender as the players walked off, gesturing that his strip was being pulled for the first 45 minutes. 
Godin had to be restrained by team-mates, before the late spitting incidents. 
The game ended 0-0, with Atletico Madrid all-but out of the La Liga title race and now fighting for a top four place.
